block.p: Jodi Ellen Sugerman, a daughter of Louise and Stephen Sugerman of Marshfield, Mass., is to be married this afternoon to Alexander Michael Brozan, the son of Nadine and Ralph Brozan of New York. Rabbi Toba Spitzer is to perform the ceremony at the Nahant Country Club in Nahant, Mass.

The bride, 29, is a co-director of educational programs at Alternatives for Community and Environment, an environmental justice organization in Roxbury, Mass. She graduated from Connecticut College and received a master's degree in urban and environmental policy from Tufts University. Her father is a pharmacist at a CVS pharmacy in Hanover, Mass. Her mother is a travel agent at Garber Travel in Braintree, Mass.

Jodi Ellen Sugerman, a daughter of Louise and Stephen Sugerman of Marshfield, Mass., is to be married this afternoon to Alexander Michael Brozan, the son of Nadine and Ralph Brozan of New York. Rabbi Toba Spitzer is to perform the ceremony at the Nahant Country Club in Nahant, Mass.

The bride, 29, is a co-director of educational programs at Alternatives for Community and Environment, an environmental justice organization in Roxbury, Mass. She graduated from Connecticut College and received a master's degree in urban and environmental policy from Tufts University. Her father is a pharmacist at a CVS pharmacy in Hanover, Mass. Her mother is a travel agent at Garber Travel in Braintree, Mass.

The bridegroom, 27, graduated summa cum laude from Tufts, where he was elected to Phi Beta Kappa. He is to begin studying for a law degree at Northeastern University later this month. His mother is a reporter on the metropolitan desk of The New York Times. His father is the senior partner in Brozan & Brozan, a law firm in New York.
